attributes.additional_details: The Wedgewood Museum has to be sold to fund a £134 million shortfall in the Pension Fund, despite it having been separated from the company for decades. This is a world class collection and cannot be allowed to be broken up and sold. It is the finest example of a historic combination of art and business that made Britain great. The pieces were donated for us the British public to share in their beauty and be inspired not sold to wealth collectors unlikely to be seen again.
